entry.title: Two Roseburg FFA teams head to nationals
entry.summary: For the first time in Roseburg history, two of the FFA teams will be heading to Indianapolis for the 96th National FFA convention the first week in November.

entry.title: Roseburg City Council votes to pursue expansion of Brown Park
entry.summary: The Roseburg City Council voted unanimously and enthusiastically Monday to approve going forward with the purchase of a half-acre tract of land which would allow expansion of historic Brown Park.

entry.title: Roseburg receives tennis and pickleball court grant
entry.summary: Grab your racquets and paddles, Roseburg, there are about to be some brand-new tennis and pickleball courts at Stewart Park.

entry.summary: The Vietnam Veterans of America Chapter 805 will host an Agent Orange Toxic Exposure Meeting on Saturday.

entry.title: Fire season comes to an end
entry.summary: Douglas Forest Protective Association officially announced the end of the 2023 fire season. The season officially ended at noon Monday.

entry.title: FIRE SEASON HAS ENDED AS OF 12:00 P.M. MONDAY
entry.summary: October 9, 2023 11:20 a.m. The Douglas Forest Protective Association has ended fire season for the lands that are under its protection as of 12:00 p.m. Monday. Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said this is a result of the recent wetting rains and the overall cooling trend that has returned to the area. Pope said...

entry.title: Local foods initiative funding info meeting
entry.summary: The Small Farms program at the Oregon State University Extension Service in Roseburg is holding an online informational meeting at noon Wednesday about local foods initiative funding.

entry.title: ROSEBURG WITH RECORD BREAKING HIGH ON SUNDAY

entry.title: COLUMBUS DAY/INDIGENOUS PEOPLES DAY MONDAY
entry.summary: October 9, 2023 4:00 a.m. Monday is observed as Columbus Day nationally and all federal offices are closed. Regular mail will not be delivered. Some banks and credit unions will not be open. The State of Oregon recognizes the day as Indigenous People’s Day, though state government offices remain open. Oregon has nine federally recognized...

entry.title: APPLICANTS NEEDED FOR COUNTY PLANNING COMMISSION
entry.summary: October 9.2023 3:30 a.m. The Douglas County Board of Commissioners is accepting applications for volunteer representatives on the Douglas County Planning Commission. The commission is a seven-member advisory and decision-making body within county government. Members represent differing interests, geographic areas and occupations. The term of appointment is four years. The commission advises the county on...

entry.title: Watch the eclipse, stay safe
entry.summary: The world as we know it will become only slightly dark for about four minutes and 20 seconds beginning at 9:16 a.m. next Saturday in Roseburg and other parts of Douglas County.

entry.title: Ring of Fire solar eclipse
entry.summary: About once every year or two, the moon aligns to cover most or all of the sun, producing a solar eclipse. This Oct. 14, the new moon will cover about 91% of the apparent diameter of the sun.

entry.title: Western Oregon University summer honor roll
entry.summary: MONMOUTH — Western Oregon University announced the undergraduate students that have been named to the honor roll and President’s list for academic honors for summer 2023.
